short_summary: Supply, installation, and delivery of Flow cytometer

Marie. the trade agreements includes Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)....
duration_in_months: user will need to check the solicitation document for the tender description, the far greater detail in terms of content-heavy section
full_summary:
=================

### Tender for Supply, Delivery, and Installation of a Flow Cytometer

---

#### Notice Details

* **Reference Number:** WS4213016903
* **Publication Date:** September 25, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** October 16, 2023, at 14:00 (Also known as 2:00 PM local time)
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** November 23, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** None

#### Contract Details

* **Procurement Category:** Goods and Services (GD)
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive Open Tender
* **Selection Criteria:** Variations or combinations of the above methods
* **Limited Tendering Reason:** None

#### Location

* **Delivery Location:** Sault Ste. Marie
* **Contracting Entity Address:** 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada

#### Notice Information

* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Notice URL:** <https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17541022>
* **Contact Person:** Denton, Crystal (SPAC/PSPC)  
**Email:** [crystal.denton@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:crystal.denton@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

#### Additional Information

* **Flow Cytometer Supply:** The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is soliciting a formal Request for Proposal (RFP) for the supply, delivery, and installation of a Flow Cytometer to the Department of Natural Resources (NRCan)
* **Suggested UN/SPSC Code:** *041100000 (Laboratory and Scientific Equipment)

---




---

This tender was originally posted in the Canadian Public Tenders Website. If you have any additional information that you want to add to this tender, you can do so in the comments section. 

(editor’s note)
I assumed that the expected contract end date was not known at the time of the tender and therefore left it blank. However if you know the contract end date you should replace “None”. Make sure you add it in the format listed above in the **Expected Contract End Date** line.
